chronic_conditions.description: Enlarged posterior cervical lymph node (2 cm), mildly tender and mobile.
Erythematous follicular papules and hyperpigmented nodules, some with central erosion and ulceration, distributed on trunk, arms, legs, face, and scalp.
Abdomen soft with tenderness on palpation of the right upper quadrant, no distension, bowel sounds present.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Lymphadenopathy detected in the neck 4 years ago and now presented in axillary regions, rash evolving over 2 years with persistent and varying characteristics.

skin_biopsy.description: Revealed acute neutrophilic folliculitis with follicular rupture and inflammation.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The skin condition worsened over time, with ongoing symptoms despite treatment.

abdominal_pain.description: Acute right upper quadrant pain, sharp and constant, worsened by movement; no gastrointestinal symptoms noted.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive worsening of abdominal pain noted over 24 hours leading to emergency presentation.
